question_text: A technician accidentally installs a 24-pin power connector into a legacy 20-pin motherboard. What is the MOST likely result?
answer_options: The motherboard will not receive any power
The extra 4 pins will short the board and cause permanent damage
The motherboard will power on if the correct 20 pins are aligned
The CPU will overheat due to voltage mismatch
correct_answer: The motherboard will power on if the correct 20 pins are aligned
explanation: Most 24-pin connectors are designed to support older 20-pin headers. As long as the connector is properly aligned, the system should function.
